applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several reasons: 1) The document is a pension scheme rules document that outlines the operation and governance of a pension life cover scheme, not a terms of business document. 2) The document is specifically labeled as 'Scheme Rules' and contains detailed provisions about the operation of a pension scheme including definitions, benefits, trustee duties, and winding up procedures. 3) While AIB Life is mentioned as the life office and registered administrator, this document serves a different regulatory purpose (pension scheme documentation) than a terms of business document which would outline the general relationship between the regulated entity and its consumers. 4) The document is governed primarily by pension legislation (Pensions Act 1990) and tax legislation (TCA), rather than consumer protection regulations. 5) The document's purpose is to establish and govern a specific pension scheme rather than set out general terms of business between a regulated entity and consumers.
regulation_title: Terms of business to be drawn up and provided
regulation_text: 51. (1) A regulated entity shall draw up its terms of business and shall provide a copy on paper or on another durable medium to each consumer to which it provides financial services, prior to providing the first service to that consumer. (2) For the purposes of paragraph (1), insofar as concerns a regulated entity that is an intermediary providing regulated activities on behalf of another regulated entity, only the intermediary is required to provide a copy of its terms of business to the cons umer. (3) A regulated entity shall provide its terms of business to a consumer as a stand -alone document. (4) A regulated entity shall make its terms of business available to consumers on any website of the regulated entity.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
